description: The Ditto Protocol error response is sent in response to a command that failed during execution.
title: Ditto Protocol error response

topic.description:
Contains the topic of the error including on which channel it was issued: `<namespace>/<name>/<group>/<optional-channel>/errors`
* for Thing related errors: `<namespace>/<name>/things/twin/errors`
* for Policy related errors: `<namespace>/<name>/policies/errors`

correlation-id.description: The correlation-id header is used for linking one message with another. It typically links a reply message with its requesting message.

path.description: The path is always `/` for error responses.

value.description: The _value_ field contains information about the error that occurred.

status.title: Error status
status.description: The status code of the error with HTTP status code semantics (e.g.: 4xx for user errors, 5xx for server errors).

error.title: Error code
error.description:
The error code or identifier that uniquely identifies the error.
This code is not to be considered as API and must therefore not be relied on.
It might change without prior notice.

message.title: Error message
message.description: The human readable message that explains what went wrong during the execution of a command/message.

description.title: Error description
description.description: Contains further information about the error e.g. a hint what caused the problem and how to solve it.

href.title: Error link
href.description: A link to further information about the error and how to fix it.

status.description: The status code that indicates the result of the command. The semantics of the used status codes are based on the [HTTP status codes](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6).
